item.title: Large hole in pavement from missing Large concrete bell bollard at junction of royal parade and Bromley road, opposite War memorial., 10th November
item.description:
Large whole in pavement due to missing large concrete bell bollard at above location. Bell bollard can be found further up road in Royal parade outside Royal parade dry cleaner’s
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Lane, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Hackney Have lost control over abandoned bikes, 10th November
item.description:
These bikes over the past week have taken over Finsbury Park Road and are causing issues for residents, pedestrians and business. Its about time Hackney adopted policies such as other boroughs to address this unacceptable issue

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bin, 10th November
item.description:
Have reported for the 3rd time now but issue not fixed . Abandoned bin that’s overflowing . With wind the entire bin toppled and a. Local resident and me put everything back into the bin. Needs to be cleared and removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Parish Gate Drive, Falconwood, Sidcup, London

item.title: Waste - cul-de-sac of Ravenscourt Road, 10th November
item.description:

item.title: Oxfam and Electronics Recyling Box Problem! Needs a permanent fix as this is horrible for the neighbourhood - rubbish just everywhere every day., 10th November
item.description:
This is now the 3rd report, and aware that there are reports almost every day. The oxfam and electronics boxes need to be removed as even when the LA "fixes" the issue, within a day clothes, household items are just thrown on the road and just littering.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council bin dragged with trash, 10th November
item.description:
The council bin on corner of Brighton Road and Nevill Road has been dragged down the road with a pile of rubbish blocking g access to bicycle shed. New bin welcome but is becoming a dumping point for fly tipping

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nevill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
